required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Long-pulsed 1064 nm nd: Yag Laser-assisted Hair Removal on Some Skin Flora and Pathogens: an in Vivo Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Long-pulsed 1064 nm nd: Yag Laser-assisted Hair Removal on Some Skin Flora and Pathogens: an in Vivo Study

brief_summary.textblock:
1. To evaluate the effect of ND-YAG laser hair removal on some skin flora and pathogens: an in vivo study.
2. To determine the immediate and long term effect of ND-YAG laser on total viable bacterial count, some skin flora and pathogens of laser-assisted hair removal in axilla.
3. To assess the relation between this effect and bromohidrosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
This Quasi-experimental interrupted time series study will be conducted on 30 female participants who will be recruited from the Dermatology Outpatient Clinic of the Alexandria Main University Hospital.
Four sessions of laser assisted hair removal at 4 weeks intervals (S1, S2, S3 and S4) using long pulsed ND: YAG (Cynosure Elite+â„¢, Westford, USA). The following parameters will be used according to the nature of hair (1064 nm, 15-18 mm spot size, fluence of 24-35 J/cm2, pulse duration 30-40 ms).
4. Swabs will be collected immediately and after each session

primary_outcome.measure: to compare changes in bacterial count and composition of axillary flora after laser hair removal
primary_outcome.description: counting bacterial colonies (aerobic,anaerobic,lipophyllic and staphylococcal) using colony counter

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the immediate and long term effect of ND-YAG laser on total viable bacterial count, some skin flora and pathogens of laser-assisted hair removal in axilla
secondary_outcome.description: counting bacterial colonies immediately before and immediately after each laser session

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the relation between this effect and bromohidrosis.
secondary_outcome.description: using a questionnaire that is categorized into better , worse or unchanged sweat odour.

clinical_study.condition: Changes in Bacterial Count in Axilla After Laser Hair Removal

arm_group.description: monthly sessions of laser hair removal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
No previous laser hair removal sessions involving axilla. Fitzpatrick skin type III-VI.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Skin diseases such as atopic dermatitis, psoriasis, fungal or herpetic infections.
2. Systemic diseases such as diabetes or endocrinal dysfunction.
3. Patients receiving immunosuppressive therapy.
4. Pregnant or lactating females.
